conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B, C, and D, and the task is to predict which container (E, F, or G) it will flow into after passing through baffles.
The yellow liquid is released at A, located at the top-left of the panel.
The yellow liquid released at A makes its way down the left-hand side of the panel and ends up in the left-most container → E.
The green liquid is released at B, located near the top-center of the panel.
The green liquid released at B is guided toward the same left-hand side by the first orange baffle, joins the yellow stream, and also reaches container E.
The cyan liquid is released at C, located near the top-right of the panel.
The cyan liquid released at C is deflected by the central grey baffle and then by the long red baffle, so it travels to the middle outlet → F.
The blue liquid is released at D, located at the top-right of the panel.
The blue liquid released at D travels almost straight down the right side, with only a slight deflection from the blue baffle, and finally reaches the right-hand container → G.
Final answer: A → E, B → E, C → F, D → G.
